critique: The document establishes an agreement with the Silk Association of America to temporarily bind them to the Cotton Textile Industry Code under the National Industrial Recovery Act. This involves government intervention in the silk industry by imposing regulations from another sector, indicating a move towards economic intervention. There is no direct mention of social issues, immigration, executive power, federalism, or security/liberty concerns, so these aspects are neutral. The document seems focused on immediate economic measures during the Depression era.
